page.title: 07EPPING CHURCH'S PROBLEMS
page.content: St.John's,the{parish church}in Epping, has to do more,with less money,in 1985.It costs {Â£70 }a day to run the church.Until recently,homeless people were able to sleep in the church porch, but vandals throwing stones and kicking sleepers forced the porch to be closed at night.However, the church is open daily and the vicar is always ready to{listen to,help,and understand many people who come with problems.He feels that young people today lack discipline.Non church-goers take its facilities for granted,and requests to be married and baptised are expected to be immediately welcomed and granted.The greatest{challenge}in 1985 for the building is the north- facing side of the{roof,}which is leaking and badly needs repairs costing{Â£40,000.}Major fund-raising plans are in operation.
